Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration Officer erred in refusing the application due to the applicant's failure to attend the interview
Burden_of_Proof: Immigration officer must prove notice was sent; applicant failed to provide valid reason for non-attendance
Credibility_Factor: Speculative explanations for non-receipt of notice were unsupported
Legal_Rule: Immigration officers must prove they sent an interview notice to the correct address or fax number. Rejection is permissible if the applicant misses the interview without valid reasons.
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on jurisdictional practice
Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to receive interview notice
Grounds_for_Claim: Claim that interview notice was not received
Outcome_on_Merits: No error found in the Immigration Officer's decision
Review_Standard: No question of general importance certified
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Notice was sent to correct fax number used by consultancy firm; procedural fairness upheld
Key_Evidence_Considered: Fax transmission evidence, affidavit from consultancy firm
Legal_Framework: Immigration regulations regarding interview notifications and residency applications
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged refusal of permanent residency based on missed interview
Defendant_Response: Evidence showed notice was faxed to correct number
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to attend mandatory interview without valid reason
Applicable_Process: Interview requirement in immigration application process
Governing_Rule: Immigration officers must prove service of notice; applicants must attend interviews unless excused
